item.title: 7 Best Robo Romances In Games, Ranked
item.description:
Love is in the air or maybe for robots it could be said that sparks or radio waves are in the air. Robots need love too and there have been so many great works of fiction that have explored what it is to be a robot in love. A recent movie, for example, is Companion although that took a horrific turn.

Some of the best robot romances in games between two mechanical beings or a robot and a human have ended just as disastrously. Still, for some fleeting moments, they found happiness. So, with full spoilers on for the following games, let’s rank how powerful these romances became across a wide plethora of consoles.

7 Febronia and Virgil (Xenosaga Episode 3: Also Sprach Zarathustra)

A Villain Redeemed…Sort Of

Xenosaga is a complicated trilogy on the PS2 with heavy themes of religion and tons of characters. One of the villains, Virgil, is a racist against the androids of this universe called Realians. He doesn’t go into details about why before getting gunned down very early in the first game only to return as The Blue Testament later, the Testaments being a religious supergroup. In the final game, players learn that Virgil fell in love with a Realian, Febronia, who shared some of her mechanical organs with Virgil to save his life. Unfortunately, other Realians hunting for Virgil kill Febronia which is where his deepened hatred for Realians comes into play. In the end, the angelic form of Febronia comes to comfort Virgil after Shion and the other defeat his alter ego, and they embrace once more.

6 Zero And Iris (Mega Man X4)

What Am I Fighting For?!

Mega Man X4 is the first main X entry to hit the PS1 and it gave fans exactly what they wanted: distinct playable campaigns for both X and Zero. Of the two, Zero has the harder campaign and also the more tragic backstory. One of the operators at command, Iris, is in love with Zero and he shares this fondness back with her.

When things start to heat up toward the end, Iris is killed in the Reploid rebellion leaving Zero to cry over her body. The English version makes this tender and tragic moment a bit hilarious because the dub is a bit awkwardly acted.

5 Robo and Atropos (Chrono Trigger)

Mother Brain Strikes Again

Chrono Trigger takes the heroes to multiple periods including the then future of 1999. Here they find a robot, Robo, who they repair and then fight some other robots in his series before jumping in a time gate. Later in the game, they find another robot in the future, Atropos XR, who claims to have been Robo’s female companion. Robo is at first excited but then he learns Atropos XR means to do his new friends harm so a one-on-one boss battle occurs. Mother Brain, not the Metroid version, reprogrammed Atropos XR to be evil, leading to a bittersweet end. Revenge is taken soon after as the party confronts and dismantles Mother Brain and pays respect to Atropos XR.

4 Claptrap and GlaDOS (Poker Night 2)

A Very Fast Courtship

  • Developer: April 24, 2013 (Xbox 360 Version)
  • Publisher: Telltale Games
  • Released: Telltale Games
  • Platform: Xbox 360, PS3, PC, iOS

Poker Night 2 is one of the more forgotten indie games of the Xbox 360 era. Players could compete in poker matches with Claptrap from Borderlands , Sam from Sam and Max , Brock Samson from The Venture Bros. , and Ash from The Evil Dead . Also, GlaDOS from Portal was the card dealer. Throughout matches, a story would unfold between Claptrap and GlaDOS which began as flirtations then to them moving in together, and then to their breakup. While it ends disastrously, the dialogue in-between is funny and it’s equally fun to imagine these two robots hooking up outside of the game.

3 Enya and Su (Stellar Blade)

Love At The End Of The World

One of the best side quests in Stellar Blade involves two robotic-looking entities named Enya and Su. There’s a bar in the HUB town of Xion wherein Eve will meet Su. He wants to fix Enya up who barely has a body to stand on anymore. This side quest will take a few different entries to fully restore Enya to her fully voiced self even involving Enya trying to do something nice for Su. While they may look like complete opposites, these two love each other dearly. It’s the sweetest couple in the game for sure and maybe even in the post-apocalypse.

2 Joker and EDI (Mass Effect 3)

Taking Vehicle Love Way Too Far

Joker is the pilot of the ship in Mass Effect who is assisted by an A.I. named EDI. The two don’t get along at first with some playful banter starting in the second game. Eventually, they grow on each other to the point of players, as Commander Shepard, assisting Joker in getting a body for EDI by Mass Effect 3 so that Joker and EDI can be together more intimately.

Depending on the ending players get, Joker and EDI could even become the same sentient species neither robot nor human. As weird as it is to fall in love with a ship that then gets a body, it is nice that Joker and EDI seemingly have a happy ending together.

1 Aegis and Makoto (Persona 3)

An All-Purpose Robot Looking For Love

Persona 3 is the first game in the series that introduced the Social Links aspects to gameplay. Players could hang out with party members or other characters to build their relationships with them. Makoto, the canonical name for the protagonist, can even date a robot. What makes this game stand out above others is that it feels like a real courtship as players can see Aegis, a battle android, who slowly learns the way of humans. It’s sweet even if it is only fleeting. What makes this romance seem like one of the better options is Aegis’ attachment. It’s so powerful that there was even DLC for the original PS2 game, albeit in a repackaged version, that saw her try to bring Makoto back from death. That’s love pure and simple whether it’s perceived as romantic or plutonic.

item.title: Fallout Fans Should Keep an Eye on Atomfall
item.description:
Summary

  • Atomfall, set to release in March 2025, promises to offer a Fallout-like experience with survival mechanics and a unique setting based on a nuclear disaster in England.
  • Along with strong similarities, Atomfall distinguishes itself from Fallout with more vibrant environments and stricter resource management.
  • The game draws heavily from folk horror works, promising a narrative-rich experience for fans of post-apocalyptic FPS.

Though Fallout saw a resurgence of popularity recently thanks to last year's well-received Amazon TV show and a subsequent bump in player numbers for some of its latest entries, the next mainline title in the franchise likely won't be released until much later in the decade, if not after. Players seeking more Fallout thus may need to look elsewhere for the time being to sate their craving for open-world post-apocalyptic action games. Announced only last year, Rebellion Developments' forthcoming Atomfall seems to squarely fit this bill.

Most fans are probably familiar with the studio through its long-running Sniper Elite series, which received its latest entry, Sniper Elite: Resistance , this past January. Following closely on its heels, Atomfall is set to release on March 27, 2025. And based on what the developer has revealed about it so far, Atomfall is shaping up to tick many of the boxes for a Fallout -adjacent experience while also being an intriguing one in its own right, making it one that fans of the latter should consider checking out when it drops.

Atomfall will be a day one Game Pass inclusion.

Atomfall Appears to Have Major Fallout Vibes

Atomfall's Similarities to Fallout

The biggest comparison between Atomfall and Fallout is in their set-ups and premises. Atomfall takes place in an alternate reality after the real-life Windscale fire disaster that occurred in the late 1950s at one of Britain's nuclear facilities. It was the worst event of its kind in the region's history, and the game will thrust players into a quarantined version of the area to explore the aftermath and uncover the truth of how and why it happened while navigating the dangers that have appeared in its wake.

In terms of design, Atomfall 's gameplay will be FPS, with the title's Steam page description outlining that fans will need to "scavenge, craft, barter, fight, and talk your way through the British countryside filled with bizarre characters, mysticism, cults, and rogue government agencies." These elements bring to mind a number of those found in Fallout , and can also be said to generally resemble other games centered around a known nuclear event, like the Stalker series.

Atomfall Distinguishes Itself from Fallout in Other Ways

While it does bear the above parallels, and Rebellion is a British-based studio, Atomfall is much more than just " Fallout in England," and contains various aspects that will set it apart. Notably, instead of a world where centuries have passed since a global nuclear exchange, Atomfall is set only five years following the Windscale event. This means that many structures are still intact and the population within the zone is more present and prominent. Atomfall 's environments look more vibrant and lived-in than what is usually seen in Fallout 's entries, making for a different prospective feel when players comb through them and encounter various groups.

Atomfall will heavily emphasize its survival-based mechanics, particularly through largely melee-focused combat and armaments based on recognizable local culture and flavor. For example, players will be required to "manage your heart rate to hold a steady aim and ensure you have the energy to reach for your cricket bat and land a killer blow." Firearm ammo and other resources are stated to be much less generously scattered throughout the world in Atomfall , forcing fans to manage these more closely and make tactical decisions about when and where to use their precious bullets or other supplies.

Rebellion has also noted that Atomfall draws heavily from folk horror works, and promises to lean into these throughout its narrative as players delve deeper into the mystery surrounding the landscape and its populace. With everything seen about it so far, Atomfall is poised to deliver an experience that Fallout fans will likely appreciate, as well as anyone looking for an interesting FPS survival-crafting title set in an alternate reality framed around the aftermath of a nuclear disaster.

item.title: Street Fighter 6: Where To Find Mai In World Tour (Outfit Reward)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Where To Find Mai In Street Fighter 6
  • How To Get Mai's Second Outfit In Street Fighter 6
    • Giving Mai Gifts
    • Acquiring The Ornamental Hairpin For Mai

Mai is the third character in Street Fighter 6 ’s second season, joining from SNK’s Fatal Fury and The King of Fighters series. Following Terry Bogard, she is the second crossover character, known for her acrobatic, fan-based fighting style. In Street Fighter 6 , she retains her fast, high-pressure gameplay, making her a strong pick for aggressive players.

Every character has a base outfit and an alternate Outfit 2, which can be unlocked with Fighter Coins or World Tour. To get Mai’s Outfit 2, players must find her in the World Tour mode and max out her bond. Here's where to find Mai and how to unlock the outfit for offline and online matches in Street Fighter 6 .

Where To Find Mai In Street Fighter 6

To find and enroll as Mai’s student, players must first complete the Knock Out Festival mission, which unlocks Terry as a Master in World Tour. Since Mai’s questline is tied to Terry’s, travel to Beat Square and then switch to “ One Fateful Day - Knock Out Festival ” at your hangout. Look for a poster near the hangout to start the Knock Out Festival 2 sub mission, change the time to nighttime, and head to the square for a cutscene.

Once the cutscene ends, talk to Alice about receiving the " KOF Event Cap a ," which must be worn to participate. Since the fights are duo battles, speak to Ichiko Kureno near the cafe in order to find a partner.

After pairing up, approach the duo opponents around the square, marked with indicators above their heads. Your opponents for the next section are:

  • Thrasher Damnd & Mad Gear Elissa
  • Rudra & Chandi
  • Hwang & Jae Hee
  • Shushu & Reirei
  • Duck Queen & Mr. Maximum

After this, talk to Alice to receive the ticket needed to travel to Pao Pao Cafe .

Since the fights are duo battles, Mai will continue fighting even if you are defeated and can often win on her own. Don’t worry too much about losing—just keep your health in check and stock up on health items from the vendor in the middle of the square.

At Pao Pao Cafe, Ichiko reveals herself as Mai, triggering a cutscene. After it ends, fast travel to Aoikigahara , which should now be unlocked on your World Map. There, another cutscene will play where Mai effortlessly fights off several ninjas before you can talk to her and officially enroll as her student .

How To Get Mai's Second Outfit In Street Fighter 6

Giving Mai Gifts

To unlock Mai’s Outfit 2, players must raise her Bond to 100. This is best done by gifting her high-value items like the Ornamental Hairpin (+40 Bond) and the Heavy Metal Demo Tape (+5 Bond).

To get the tape, head right of Aoikigahara and find Chichi , who rewards you for using an item with a debuff effect during battle . After winning, interact with the candies near the fox statue to open a path to a cave. Inside, defeat Fumitaro by landing a 5,000 damage combo to obtain the second tape.

For the 2UP Gift, you can give Mai Prepaid Cards , which cost only 1,260 coins from Shopkeeper Dora in The Lowlands - South Area of Old Nayshall .

If you're low on Zenny, try the hard challenge at the Scrap Heap mini-game in Metro City . You can earn around 15K Zenny in under 30 seconds here. Switch to Marisa’s Master style if unlocked, then hit the truck with four Heavy Punches , followed by four Downward Heavy Kicks (Sweeps) . After that, switch back to Heavy Punches until the truck explodes.

Acquiring The Ornamental Hairpin For Mai

To get the Ornamental Hairpin, travel to Metro City and talk to Alice to start The Legendary Supporting Cast mission. This only appears if you have switched to "One Fateful Day" at the hangout.

This mission requires you to fight all the cosplayers in Beat Square. Most of these fights are easy, but you can use items to boost your attack and defense if needed.

Fight the following during the day:

  • Sankaku Mochizuki
  • Iron Hand
  • Will Bobson
  • Flanco
  • Saan & Gura (This is a duo fight, so try to use your Master Summons if you've accumulated enough Super meter.)

Change the time of day to nighttime and fight:

  • Chad
  • Ron Shu Tan
  • Shushu & Reirei (You will have to fight these two one after the other, but both use the same fighting style.)
  • Mr. Maximum
  • Duck Queen (For her questions, choose the following dialogue options: Yes , then Professional Dancer , followed by Mohawk and Sunglasses .)
  • Hwang

After completing all fights, you’ll receive the Ornamental Hairpin , KOF Event Cap y , and KOF Event T-Shirt a .

item.title: Disney Dreamlight Valley: How to Make Soda Bread and Feta
item.description:
Disney Dreamlight Valley ’s list of recipes just keeps growing with every new DLC. The latest one, Storybook Vale, has added over 90 new meals. There’s everything from entrees to sweet desserts, so there’s plenty to keep you busy. One of the new dishes you can make is Soda Bread and Feta.

Soda Bread and Feta is an easy dish to cook, but figuring out its ingredients can be hard because the game doesn’t tell you outright. Don’t worry, though, because we’ve got you covered.

Soda Bread and Feta Recipe in Dreamlight Valley

Here’s what players need to make this dish:

  • 1 Flyleaf Feta
  • 1 Wheat
  • 1 Salt Crystal

Getting Flyleaf Feta in Disney Dreamlight Valley

Flyleaf Feta is a dairy and oil ingredient in DDV. Unlike the other ingredients of this category, it’s not available in Remy’s restaurant. Instead, you will need to purchase it from Goofy. Players can find it on the stall in the Bind region, and it costs 150 Star Coins. However, you might need to upgrade the shop before it shows up.

Getting Wheat in Disney Dreamlight Valley

Next on our list is wheat. It’s a basic ingredient used in tons of recipes. To get it, return to the valley and buy its seeds from the stall in the Peaceful Meadow. Players who have upgraded this stall might also find fully-grown wheat sometimes.

When planted, it will just take a minute to grow. Since Storybook Vale doesn’t have wheat, it would be a good idea to buy a bunch at once so you don’t have to keep traveling back to Dreamlight Valley.

Getting Salt Crystal in Dreamlight Valley

Salt Crystals are the last ingredient players need for Soda Bread and Feta, but they’re a bit tricky to find. You won’t get them from Goofy’s Stall or by mining. Instead, the only way to collect them is by fishing in the Everafter biome. Unlike regular fish, Salt Crystals don’t appear in blue, orange, or white ripples. They require you to cast your line into clear water. There’s plenty of space to fish in Everafter, so you won’t have a hard time farming them.

Once you have obtained all three ingredients, add one of each to a pot at any cooking station in the game. Since all of its ingredients are pretty easy to get, it doesn’t provide much value. It only gives 309 energy and sells for 135 Star Coins . But if you don’t want to eat or sell it, you can always place it in the valley.

item.title: Roblox: Fisch Codes (February 2025)
item.description:
Fisch is a fishing simulator that quickly gained popularity and easily became a favorite among other Roblox experiences. All thanks to the excellent work of the developers, a bunch of interactive features and mechanics that made the gameplay interesting and addictive.

If you want to keep up with the rest and climb the leaderboard, you'll need to work hard to improve both your equipment and skills. Luckily, you can partially simplify these tasks by redeeming Fisch codes, which offer a bunch of freebies that will definitely come in handy.

Updated February 16, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: If you're looking to enhance your Fisch experience, this guide provides the latest codes that offer valuable in-game rewards. Redeeming these codes can grant you items like Weird Algae, Truffle Worms, and baits, which can assist in your adventures. Make sure to use these codes promptly, as they may expire.

All Fisch Codes

Working Fisch Codes

  • THEKRAKEN - Redeem this code to get Sunken Ship Bobber and 2500 Cash.
  • CARBON - Redeem this code to get Carbon Bobber.
  • SORRYGUYS - Redeem this code to get 2 Kraken Tentacles.
  • ATLANTEANSTORM - Redeem this code to get 3 Rods.
  • GOLDENTIDE - Redeem this code to get 3 Instant Catchers
  • NewYear - Redeem this code to get 2 Holly Berries and 2 Peppermint Worms
  • NorthernExpedition - Redeem this code to get free rewards
  • RFG - Redeem this code to get 3 Instant Catchers

Expired Fisch Codes

  • 1BVisits - Redeem this code to get free rewards
  • GOODBYEFISCHMAS - Redeem this code to get baits
  • FISCHMASDAY - Redeem this code to get 2 Holly Berry, 2 Pepermint Worms, and 1000 Cash
  • MERRYFISCHMAS - Redeem this code to get Holy Berry and Worms
  • Advent - Redeem this code to get 2 Weird Algae and 2 Truffle Worms
  • AncientIsle - Redeem this code to get 1,500 Cash, 2 Weird Algae and 2 Truffle Worm
  • ThankYouFollowers - Redeem this code to get 2,000 Cash, 2 Weird Algae and 2 Truffle Worm
  • TheDepths - Redeem this code to get 3 Weird Algae and 3 Truffle Worms
  • Prehistoric - Redeem this code to get 1,500 Cash, 2 Weird Algae and 2 Truffle Worm
  • 100M - Redeem this code to get 6 baits.
  • 200K - Redeem this code to get 3 Weird Algae, 3 Truffle Worm.
  • Scubaaaa - Redeem this code to get 10 Coral Geodes.
  • SorryForDowntime - Redeem this code to get 10 Instant Catchers, 10 Fish Heads, and 1,000 Cash.
  • FischFright2024 - Redeem this code to get Candy Corn Bobver, Plastic Rod, and Carbon Rod.
  • ThanksFor10Mil - Redeem this code to get 10Mil Title, 40% faster Lure Speed for 1 hour, and 10,000 Cash.
  • SorryforShutdown - Redeem this code to get 15 Volcanic Geode.

Redeeming Fisch codes will be equally useful for both beginners and experienced fishermen. So be sure to use them and don't neglect them if you want to become one of the leaders on the board.

How to Redeem Codes for Fisch

Fisch uses a standard redemption system for Roblox games, so experienced players should have no problem getting rewards. However, if you're struggling with finding the right buttons, feel free to use the detailed instructions we listed below:

  • Launch Fisch .
  • Pay attention to the top of the screen. Here, under the compass, you will find the Menu button. Click on it.
  • When a new menu opens, scroll to the very bottom. Here, you will find the redemption section, which contains an input field. Now, enter one of the active codes mentioned above in this input field.
  • Lastly, press the Enter key to submit your reward request.

If everything is done correctly, you will see a notification below the menu you opened with a list of rewards received. If nothing happens, try entering the code again and make sure you didn't make any typos or insert extra spaces. If it still doesn't work, it's likely that the code has already expired, so you can try searching for fresh codes yourself or wait for us to update this page.

How to Get More Fisch Codes

If you want to stay ahead and get more Fisch codes, make sure to regularly visit the game’s official social media. Developers regularly share Roblox codes here, so check from time to time to ensure you don’t miss out on any rewards.

Why My Fisch Codes Don't Work?

The reason your codes may not work is wrong spelling or capitalization of letters. The best sing you can do to fix it is to directly copy and paste a code from our list above, instead of typing them in manually by your own. Another reason for this may be that the code has already expired. In this case, tell us what code doesn't work in the comments below.

  • Official Fisch Roblox group.
  • Official Fisch Discord server.
  • Official Fisch X account.
